course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Developmental Psychology
course.description: Developmental psychology is the scientific study of how we grow and change over the lifespan. This course will guide students to investigate physical, cognitive, and psychosocial development from infancy to late adulthood from a psychological perspective. Students should complete the course with a deeper understanding of key theories, research methods, and research findings on human development.
course.prerequisites: SOSC 1960 OR SOSC 1980

reviews.comment_teaching:
Most of the quiz MCQ options come from her speech and honestly "exact wordings" of her speech during the lecture. So you need to attend lecture and jot down exactly what she said/read. -.-'' Lecture notes and textbook wouldn't help. No need to buy the textbook, which is completely useless. She would examine some of the examples or video clips discussed and played in class. Be careful.

Class size is 80 students. But only 40-47 students attend the lecture. At the very end of the semester, only 30+ students come.

學啲野好散。某d concepts好混淆，覺得難過abnormal psy。 有極多theories and terms， 特別moral development果課。 essay都揀左Kohlberg’s theory of moral reasoning，因為friendship果課完全冇theory/concept可寫到成千字，cognitive development果個十幾廿個substages仲要包括係嬰兒時期點樣寫呀大佬，局住揀moral development寫self-reflection essay。從未試過一篇essay由學期頭開始寫keep住改到學期尾，一路寫一路驚離題，搵左勁多資料clarify個theory，根本每個substage既定義好模糊不清，當要搵個人生活例子代入去寫就會出現好多logic問題同要例子fit in, match到個定義，上堂只係講得好表面。有email問問題clarify番個theory第5個stage既定義，問到佢吾答我，可能覺得我問過界send essay draft比佢睇—speechless。 好彩最後拎34/35。 但project同組有組員話炒左essay ，所以要小心，成35%。

reviews.comment_workload:
The content of this course is even richer than that of SOSC3900 Abnormal psychology, which is also taught by Beatrice, although lots of content of SOSC2990 is much simpler and is like common sense. But it does not mean it's easier to get a good grade because the mean is terribly high. I would rather she gave higher weight to both quizzes because I spent plenty of time on re-watching the lecture recording, jotting down notes, memorizing all of the points in each slide because you won't have time to check the notes for the answers during the 30-minute quizzes in spite of open-book quizzes due to COVID-19. I think both quizzes are what truly reflect our personal effort in this course, as you have to study lots of content and the quiz's questions require you to have a pretty thorough understanding of the concepts/theories and to differentiate the differences between several concepts/theories, some questions are quite tricky although many students eventually answer them correctly as UST students are not foolish after all, that is why the mean is surprisingly high even though most students skip regular lectures.

The group project is time-consuming, due to take-home help kit. Having groupmates good at computer and design would help a lot.
